unnormalised: Hey social media enthusiasts! What’s trending? Buckle up, because the virality wheel keeps spinning faster than a dhol beat at a Delhi wedding!
normalised: Hey social media enthusiasts! What's trending? Buckle up, because the virality wheel keeps spinning faster than a dhol beat at a Delhi wedding!

unnormalised: This week, we’re seeing a surge in short, relatable reels, especially those riffing on daily struggles. Think: "When your chaiwala uncle gets your order wrong, AGAIN!" Instant meme gold.
normalised: This week, we're seeing a surge in short, relatable reels, especially those riffing on daily struggles. Think: "When your chaiwala uncle gets your order wrong, AGAIN!" Instant meme gold.

unnormalised: And the biryani craze? Still going strong! #BiryaniLove is plastered across Instagram, with food bloggers from Chennai to Chandigarh showcasing their family recipes. Expect to see Onam-themed Sadhya content pop up soon!
normalised: And the biryani craze? Still going strong! Hash Biryani Love is plastered across Instagram, with food bloggers from Chennai to Chandigarh showcasing their family recipes. Expect to see Onam-themed Sadhya content pop up soon!

unnormalised: Also, keep an eye on the “Desi Dad Reacts” genre. It's blowing up! Forget Hollywood, Indian dads reacting to the latest Bollywood tracks are the real stars. One reel featuring a Nagpur father's reaction to a Honey Singh song garnered over 1 million views in 24 hours!
normalised: Also, keep an eye on the "Desi Dad Reacts" genre. It's blowing up! Forget Hollywood, Indian dads reacting to the latest Bollywood tracks are the real stars. One reel featuring a Nagpur father's reaction to a Honey Singh song garnered over one million views in twenty four hours!

unnormalised: Influencer marketing’s taking a turn too. Authenticity is queen. Followers are calling out fake endorsements faster than you can say "sponsored content." Brands collaborating with nano-influencers (folks with a smaller, but highly engaged audience) are seeing a much higher ROI. Remember: Gen Z wants realness, not just Rs. 50 lakh endorsements.
normalised: Influencer marketing's taking a turn too. Authenticity is queen. Followers are calling out fake endorsements faster than you can say "sponsored content." Brands collaborating with nano-influencers (folks with a smaller, but highly engaged audience) are seeing a much higher R O I. Remember: Gen Z wants realness, not just rupees fifty lakh endorsements.
